meanings.definition: To surpass in cleverness or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outwile her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outwile the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The magician outwiled the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her quick thinking allowed her to outwile the tricky situation.
meanings.sent5: The fox outwiled the hunter by leading him on a false trail.

meanings.sent1: The clever squirrel outwiled the cat by climbing up the tree.
meanings.sent2: He always finds a way to outwile his competitors in business.
meanings.sent3: The students outwiled the teacher by switching seats during the break.
meanings.sent4: The athlete outwiled his opponent with a surprising move.
meanings.sent5: The spy outwiled the enemy agents by using a disguise.

meanings.sent1: The con artist tried to outwile the old lady with a fake investment scheme.
meanings.sent2: She was known for her ability to outwile her friends with practical jokes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child outwiled his parents by pretending to be asleep.
meanings.sent4: The scammer outwiled many unsuspecting victims with his smooth talk.
meanings.sent5: The illusionist outwiled the audience with his mind-bending tricks.
